sub_topic: Determining the volume of a sphere.
message_1: What is the volume of a sphere with a radius of 6 cm?
message_2:
The volume V of a sphere can be calculated using the formula:

V = (4/3)πr³

where r is the radius of the sphere. In this case, the radius is 6 cm.

V = (4/3)π(6)³

V = (4/3)π(216)

V = 288π

The volume of the sphere is approximately 904.78 cubic centimeters.
